io.atomix.catalyst.buffer

Class AbstractBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.AbstractBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, BufferInput<Buffer>, BufferOutput<Buffer>, BytesInput<Buffer>, BytesOutput<Buffer>, ReferenceCounted<Buffer>, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileBuffer, HeapBuffer, NativeBuffer, ReadOnlyBuffer, SlicedBuffer, SwappedBuffer

    public abstract class AbstractBuffer
extends Object
implements Buffer
    Abstract buffer implementation.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • bytes

        public Bytes bytes()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the bytes underlying the buffer.

        The buffer is a wrapper around Bytes that handles writing sequences of bytes by tracking positions and limits. This method returns the Bytes that this buffer wraps.

        Specified by:
        bytes in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The underlying bytes.

      • order

        public ByteOrder order()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the byte order.

        For consistency with ByteBuffer, all buffer implementations are initially in ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN order.

        Specified by:
        order in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The byte order.

      • order

        public Buffer order(ByteOrder order)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Sets the byte order, returning a new swapped Buffer instance.

        By default, all buffers are read and written in ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN order. This provides complete consistency with ByteBuffer. To flip buffers to ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN order, this buffer's Bytes instance is decorated by a SwappedBytes instance which will reverse read and written bytes using, e.g. Integer.reverseBytes(int).

        Specified by:
        order in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        order - The byte order.
        Returns:
        The updated buffer.

      • asReadOnlyBuffer

        public Buffer asReadOnlyBuffer()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns a read-only view of the buffer.

        The returned buffer will share the underlying Bytes with which buffer, but the buffer's limit, capacity, and position will be independent of this buffer.

        Specified by:
        asReadOnlyBuffer in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        A read-only buffer.

        Returns:

      • slice

        public Buffer slice()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns a view of this buffer starting at the current position.

        The returned buffer will contain the same underlying Bytes instance as this buffer, but its pointers will be offset by the current position of this buffer at the time the slice is created. Calls to Buffer.rewind() and similar methods on the resulting Buffer will result in the buffer's position being reset to the position of this buffer at the time the slice was created.

        The returned buffer is reference counted separately from this buffer. Therefore, closing the returned buffer will release the buffer back to the internal buffer poll and will not result in this buffer being closed. Users should always call Buffer.close() once finished using the buffer slice.

        Specified by:
        slice in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        A slice of this buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.slice(long), Buffer.slice(long, long)

      • slice

        public Buffer slice(long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns a view of this buffer of the given length starting at the current position.

        The returned buffer will contain the same underlying Bytes instance as this buffer, but its pointers will be offset by the current position of this buffer at the time the slice is created. Calls to Buffer.rewind() and similar methods on the resulting Buffer will result in the buffer's position being reset to the position of this buffer at the time the slice was created.

        The returned buffer is reference counted separately from this buffer. Therefore, closing the returned buffer will release the buffer back to the internal buffer poll and will not result in this buffer being closed. Users should always call Buffer.close() once finished using the buffer slice.

        Specified by:
        slice in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the slice.
        Returns:
        A slice of this buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.slice(), Buffer.slice(long, long)

      • slice

        public Buffer slice(long offset,
                    long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns a view of this buffer starting at the given offset with the given length.

        The returned buffer will contain the same underlying Bytes instance as this buffer, but its pointers will be offset by the given offset and its length limited by the given length. Calls to Buffer.rewind() and similar methods on the resulting Buffer will result in the buffer's position being reset to the given offset.

        The returned buffer is reference counted separately from this buffer. Therefore, closing the returned buffer will release the buffer back to the internal buffer poll and will not result in this buffer being closed. Users should always call Buffer.close() once finished using the buffer slice.

        Specified by:
        slice in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset at which to begin the slice.
        length - The number of bytes in the slice.
        Returns:
        The buffer slice.
        See Also:
        Buffer.slice(), Buffer.slice(long)

      • offset

        public long offset()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the buffer's starting offset within the underlying Bytes.

        The offset is used to calculate the absolute position of the buffer's relative position within the underlying Bytes.

        Specified by:
        offset in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer's offset.

      • capacity

        public long capacity()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the buffer's capacity.

        The capacity represents the total amount of storage space allocated to the buffer by the underlying storage implementation. As bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's capacity may grow up to Buffer.maxCapacity().

        Specified by:
        capacity in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer's capacity.

      • maxCapacity

        public long maxCapacity()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the maximum allowed capacity for the buffer.

        The maximum capacity is the limit up to which this buffer's capacity can be expanded. While the capacity grows, the maximum capacity is fixed from the moment the buffer is created and cannot change.

        Specified by:
        maxCapacity in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer's maximum capacity.

      • position

        public long position()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the buffer's current read/write position.

        The position is an internal cursor that tracks where to write/read bytes in the underlying storage implementation. As bytes are written to or read from the buffer, the position will advance based on the number of bytes read.

        Specified by:
        position in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer's current position.

        position in interface Buffer
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • limit

        public long limit()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the buffer's read/write limit.

        The limit dictates the highest position to which bytes can be read from or written to the buffer. If the limit is not explicitly set then it will always equal the buffer's maxCapacity. Note that the limit may be set by related methods such as Buffer.flip()

        Specified by:
        limit in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer's limit.

      • limit

        public Buffer limit(long limit)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Sets the buffer's read/write limit.

        The limit dictates the highest position to which bytes can be read from or written to the buffer. The limit must be within the bounds of the buffer, i.e. greater than 0 and less than or equal to Buffer.capacity()

        Specified by:
        limit in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        limit - The limit to set.
        Returns:
        This buffer.

      • remaining

        public long remaining()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns the number of bytes remaining in the buffer until the Buffer.limit() is reached.

        The bytes remaining is calculated by buffer.limit() - buffer.position(). If no limit is set on the buffer then the maxCapacity will be used.

        Specified by:
        remaining in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        remaining in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Returns:
        The number of bytes remaining in the buffer.

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the buffer has bytes remaining.

        If Buffer.remaining() is greater than 0 then this method will return true, otherwise false

        Specified by:
        hasRemaining in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        hasRemaining in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Returns:
        Indicates whether bytes are remaining in the buffer. true if Buffer.remaining() is greater than 0, false otherwise.

      • flip

        public Buffer flip()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Flips the buffer.

        The limit is set to the current position and then the position is set to zero. If the mark is defined then it is discarded. 

           
   assert buffer.writeLong(1234).flip().readLong() == 1234;
        Specified by:
        flip in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        This buffer.

      • mark

        public Buffer mark()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Sets a mark at the current position.

        The mark is a simple internal reference to the buffer's current position. Marks can be used to reset the buffer to a specific position after some operation. 

           
   buffer.mark();
   buffer.writeInt(1).writeBoolean(true);
   buffer.reset();
   assert buffer.readInt() == 1;
        Specified by:
        mark in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        This buffer.

      • rewind

        public Buffer rewind()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Rewinds the buffer. The position is set to zero and the mark is discarded.
        Specified by:
        rewind in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        This buffer.

      • reset

        public Buffer reset()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Resets the buffer's position to the previously-marked position.

        Invoking this method neither changes nor discards the mark's value.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface Buffer
        Returns:
        This buffer.

      • clear

        public Buffer clear()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Clears the buffer.

        The position is set to zero, the limit is set to the capacity, and the mark is discarded.

        Specified by:

      • read

        public Buffer read(Buffer buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given buffer.

        Bytes will be read starting at the current buffer position until either Buffer.limit() has been reached. If Buffer.remaining() is less than the Buffer.remaining() of the given buffer, a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer into which to read bytes.
        Returns:
        The buffer.

      • read

        public Buffer read(Bytes bytes)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array.

        Bytes will be read starting at the current buffer position until either the byte array length or the Buffer.limit() has been reached. If Buffer.remaining() is less than the length of the given byte array, a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.read(Bytes, long, long), Buffer.read(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • read

        public Buffer read(Bytes bytes,
                   long offset,
                   long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array starting at the current position.

        Bytes will be read from the current position up to the given length. If the provided length is greater than Buffer.remaining() then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown. If the offset is out of bounds of the buffer then an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        offset - The offset at which to write bytes into the given buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.read(Bytes), Buffer.read(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • read

        public Buffer read(long srcOffset,
                   Bytes bytes,
                   long dstOffset,
                   long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array starting at the given offset up to the given length.

        Bytes will be read from the given starting offset up to the given length. If the provided length is greater than - srcOffset then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown. If the srcOffset is out of bounds of the buffer then an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BytesInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        srcOffset - The offset from which to start reading bytes.
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        dstOffset - The offset at which to write bytes into the given buffer
        length - The total number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.read(Bytes), Buffer.read(Bytes, long, long)

      • read

        public Buffer read(byte[] bytes)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array.

        Bytes will be read starting at the current buffer position until either the byte array length or the Buffer.limit() has been reached. If Buffer.remaining() is less than the length of the given byte array, a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:

      • read

        public Buffer read(byte[] bytes,
                   long offset,
                   long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array starting at current position up to the given length.

        Bytes will be read from the current position up to the given length. If the provided length is greater than Buffer.remaining() then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown. If the offset is out of bounds of the buffer then an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        offset - The offset at which to write bytes into the given buffer
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.read(byte[]), Buffer.read(long, byte[], long, long)

      • read

        public Buffer read(long srcOffset,
                   byte[] bytes,
                   long dstOffset,
                   long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads bytes into the given byte array starting at the given offset up to the given length.

        Bytes will be read from the given starting offset up to the given length. If the provided length is greater than Buffer.remaining() then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown. If the offset is out of bounds of the buffer then an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        read in interface BytesInput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        srcOffset - The offset from which to start reading bytes.
        bytes - The byte array into which to read bytes.
        dstOffset - The offset at which to write bytes into the given buffer
        length - The total number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.read(byte[]), Buffer.read(byte[], long, long)

        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads a byte from the buffer at the current position.

        When the byte is read from the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by Bytes.BYTE. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown.

      • readUTF8

        public String readUTF8()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads a UTF-8 string from the buffer at the current position.

        When the string is read from the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by 2 bytes plus the byte length of the string. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferUnderflowException will be thrown.

      • write

        public Buffer write(Buffer buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a buffer to the buffer.

        When the buffer is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by the number of bytes in the provided buffer. If the provided Buffer.remaining() exceeds Buffer.remaining() then an BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.

      • write

        public Buffer write(Bytes bytes)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        When the bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by the number of bytes in the provided byte array. If the number of bytes exceeds Buffer.limit() then an BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes, long, long), Buffer.write(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • write

        public Buffer write(Bytes bytes,
                    long offset,
                    long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        The bytes will be written starting at the current position up to the given length. If the length of the byte array is larger than the provided length then only length bytes will be read from the array. If the provided length is greater than the remaining bytes in this buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        offset - The offset at which to start writing the bytes.
        length - The number of bytes from the provided byte array to write to the buffer.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes), Buffer.write(long, Bytes, long, long)

      • write

        public Buffer write(long offset,
                    Bytes bytes,
                    long srcOffset,
                    long length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes an array of bytes to the buffer.

        The bytes will be written starting at the given offset up to the given length. If the remaining bytes in the byte array is larger than the provided length then only length bytes will be read from the array. If the provided length is greater than Buffer.limit() minus offset then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        write in interface BytesOutput<Buffer>
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset at which to start writing the bytes.
        bytes - The array of bytes to write.
        srcOffset - The offset at which to begin reading bytes from the source.
        length - The number of bytes from the provided byte array to write to the buffer.
        Returns:
        The written buffer.
        See Also:
        Buffer.write(Bytes), Buffer.write(Bytes, long, long)

      • writeUnsignedShort

        public Buffer writeUnsignedShort(long offset,
                                 int s)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 16-bit signed integer to the buffer at the given offset.

        The short will be written at the given offset. If there are less than Bytes.SHORT bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

      • writeInt

        public Buffer writeInt(int i)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the buffer at the current position.

        When the integer is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by Bytes.INTEGER. If less than Bytes.INTEGER bytes are remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        writeInt in interface Buffer
        Specified by:

      • writeBoolean

        public Buffer writeBoolean(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a 1 byte boolean to the buffer at the current position.

        When the boolean is written to the buffer, the buffer's position will be advanced by 1. If there are no bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        writeBoolean in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>

      • writeUTF8

        public Buffer writeUTF8(String s)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Writes a UTF-8 string to the buffer at the current position.

        The string will be written with a two-byte unsigned byte length followed by the UTF-8 bytes. If there are not enough bytes remaining in the buffer then a BufferOverflowException will be thrown.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Closes the buffer.

        This method effectively acts as an alias to ReferenceCounted.release() and allows buffers to be used as resources in try-with-resources statements. When the buffer is closed the internal reference counter defined by ReferenceCounted will be decremented. However, if references to the buffer still exist then those references will be allowed to continue to operate on the buffer until all references have been released.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Buffer
        Specified by:
        close in interface BufferInput<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface BufferOutput<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface ReferenceCounted<Buffer>
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
